Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year 1963 Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring abstract design composed of thin white lines grouped together against a black background to resemble a tree. Verso: Printed in red, across lower portion: merry christmas and a happy new year 1963 herbert and joella bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and Happy 1969 from Joella and Herbert Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Joella and Herbert Bayer Christmas card featuring Bayer's 1967 painting, "Chromatic Into Two Centers." Painting incorporates repeated squares, triangles, and other geometric forms in yellow, orange, red, green, blue, and purple. Verso: Printed text in black, diagonally, lower right: merry christmas and happy 1969 from joella and herbert bayer / chromatic into two centers, 1967.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: To My Valentine (Greeting card)
description: This card depicts two winged cupids at the center with flowers and curved framing surrounding. Above their heads, text in brown: To My / Valentine. One cupid stands on a flower-covered ladder delivering a white envelope with a red heart, as the other cupid looks on, holding the ladder. Flanking them are two die-cut paper vases holding two-dimensional flowers drawn directly onto the card.

title: Christmas/New Years Greeting Card
description: Dark green fish on cover; partial green fish inside right edge.
medium: Print on heavy green card stock

title: Christmas/New Years Greeting Card
description: Fold-out side flaps printed in white as barn doors open to reveal message in red ink.
medium: Print on heavy mustard card stock.

title: Christmas/New Years Greeting Card
description: Fold-out side flaps printed in white as barn doors open to reveal message in red ink.

title: Valentine (Greeting card)
description: Bouquet of colorful flowers in pink, blue, yellow, and leaves of different greens. Cut paper is decorated with spirals and dots. Inscriptions throughout.
provenance: Virginia Gerson; 1930: acquired by Museum

title: Valentine (Greeting card)
description: Within an embossed cut-paper frame with stylized floral decorations is a floral wreath of colored cut-paper, and paint additions, with a cupid holding a heart. Above is written (in blue ink): "In sweetest dreams thy lovely form I view/Accept this token of my love for you.
provenance: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

title: Valentine (Greeting card)
description: Within an embossed cut paper frame, with arabesque ornamentation is a vertical oval containing an inscribed printed paper heart, with a silk bow below and flowers in chromolithograph and gilt paint. Double sheet folded in half, horizontally.
medium: Embossed cut paper with gilt paint and chromo-lithograph additions
provenance: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

title: Valentine (Greeting card)
description: Within an embossed cut-paper frame with floral decorations is a circular peep-hole, covered by silk gauze, through which two birds in gilt are seen against a blue ground. Velvet cording and flowers of shirred silk around edges, and cupids at top of embossed gilt paper.
provenance: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

Card with David and His Harp (Greeting card)
description: Constructed of several parts, joined together:  a ship in full sail with mounted cut-outs of vases of flowers and the Statue of Liberty, David and his harp. New Year's greeting in Hebrew and English revealed when closed.
provenance: Mrs. Dorothy Harrower; 1954: acquired by Museum

title: Greeting Card with Forget-Me-Nots
description: Inside an ornamented gilt frame is a sheet of lined note paper, with a basket of forget-me-nots, a paper heart and a girl, attached, upper left. On a double sheet of paper, folded in half, horizontally.
provenance: Mrs. Dorothy Harrower; 1954: acquired by Museum

title: Greeting card
description: An oval chromolithograph of a girl surprising a boy with a paper frame of gilt, embossed paper.  Inside, inscribed on blue paper is:  "Had I thy wings, oh dove,/High midst the clouds to soar,/ Soon would the strongest cords of love/ Bring me to earth once more.
provenance: Collection of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: A bunch of flowers in an oval frame, hinged, and hiding a nine-line poem entitled: "I love thee".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: In an oval frame, two children, in eighteenth-century dress, are seen playing in a landscape.
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: On cover, bunch of flowers in the center. Inside, oval frame, left blank, and sticker inscribed: "I love thee my sweetheart". Enframement of blue and white embossed paper.
medium: Embossed chromolithograph on double-folded embossed cut paper
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Greeting card
description: Two children show in a parade.  One carries a banner inscribed: "Accept my love".  Inside (in purple ink):  "To Mabel Hannah commonly called Mabel Cooper on Valentine's Day 1879".

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: In the center, a floral spray around an embossed gold paper wedding ring encircling Cupid as a letter-carrier. Inscribed in blue ink: "May Cupid thee to pity move / For pity melts the soul to love".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: In the center, landscape, with two lovers seated near a large tree. Inscribed below on print: "My all on earth".
medium: Brush and watercolor on embossed paper
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Greeting card
description: Envelope with card probably not original to card

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: In the center, a vignette showing a marriage ceremony. Below, two cupids hold a ribbon inscribed: "Come, lip to lip, in love's embrace / In me a faithful spirit trace / A life of love that will not die / Secure in its own constancy".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: In the center, a spray of lilies-of-the-valley. Inscribed, printed in black ink: "Accept my heart dear youth / In every throp 'tis true, / Beauty, youth and endless Spring / Dwell upon thy rosy wing. / In every pulse it beans / with constant love to you".
medium: Brush and oil paint on double-folded embossed paper
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: In the center, morning glories with Venus and Cupid resting in the blossoms. Inscribed (printed in black ink): "Sweet floral Spirits in thy Flight / Thro balmy bowers of bliss above, / Let drop a wreath which may unite / In roseate bonds thy heart I love".
medium: Brush and watercolor on embossed paper
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: In the center, a bunch of flowers. Inscribed in blue ink, above: "How Blest my Love" and below: "If you approve". Embossed paper enframement.
medium: Brush and watercolor on embossed paper
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Remembrance Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: A bunch of flowers (in oclor) in embossed paper enframement. Inscribed above, in ink: "Oh let my love thy pity move" and below: "In pity metls the Soul to love".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Remembrance Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: Bunch of wood roses, left; below, an inscriptional ribbon carrying a six-line poem in four verses. Upper right, an engraving montage of a Russian Cossack and his bride.
medium: Brush and watercolor montage on paper
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Marriage Good Wishes (Greeting Card)
description: Two ladders form a flower arbor over a path. Inscribed at top: "The Ladder of Matrimony". At top of ladder: "Congratulation"; at left: Consideration, Dissimulation, Disapprobation, Provocation, Detestation, Desperation, Separation"; at right: "Acceptation, Palpitation, Hesitation, Declaration, Expectation, Flirtation, Admiration".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Marriage Good Wishes (Greeting Card)
description: Two ladders form a rose arbor over a path. Inscribed at top: "Matrimony as it should be". At top of ladder: "Solemnization"; at left: "Love increasing, care unceasing, to be pleasing, will secure Earth's greatest blessing, Domestic happiness". At right:" Acceptation, Approbation, Soft persuasion, Hesitation, Declaration, Admiration".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Christmas Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: Simulated envelope with chromolithograph of flowers in center. Double flap on back opens to reveal a white silk cushion on which is printed: "Wishing a happy Christmas to You".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

description: Standing man with ivy before him. Below, four-line verse. At top left: "Ivy

title: Mary & Don Deskey's 1924 Christmas Card (Greeting card)
description: Mary & Don Deskey’s 1924 winter holiday card. Vertical format block printed in black ink on green wove paper features stylized stained-glass-window design with cubist influence and gothic arch; above, Santa is seen with a Christmas tree, toys, and horse; below, various toys, gingerbread house, candle, and bell; lowest register with serif lettering that states “Mary & Don Deskey-1924”.
medium: Block printed on green wove paper
provenance: Robert M. Desky, San Mateo, CA, USA; 1993: acquired by Museum

title: Christmas Card with Rooster (Greeting card)

title: Cloud Shadows (Greeting card)
description: Notecard produced for the Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center featuring "Cloud Shadows," a drawing by Herbert Bayer (1947). Blank interior. Printed in black, verso, lower left: CLOUD SHADOWS - drawing / Herbert Bayer, American (1900- ) / Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center. Pairs with 2016-54-469 (envelope).
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and Happy New Year, Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card. Photomontage print featuring one side of a snowy wooden building with four open squares for windows. In background, sepia-toned image of snowy forest. Printed text in black, upper margin: merry christmas and happy new year  herbert and joella bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and a Happy 1960, Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card. Blue print on silver background. Features a patterned globe at top and two cherubs at bottom. Printed in blue, along the bottom: merry christmas and a happy 1960 herbert and joella bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and Happy New Year from Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring abstract design with ovals, lines, curving lines, and circles in black and white on blue-green background. Printed in black, along the bottom: merry christmas and happy new year from herbert and joella bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas & Happy New Year, Joella and Herbert Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Joella and Herbert Bayer Christmas card. At center, a seven-pointed falling star with lines radiating upwards in raised metallic red foil. Printed in green, along the bottom: merry christmas & happy new year / joella / herbert } bayer.
medium: Print on light brown paper with embossed red foil
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas, Joella – Herbert Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring black and white photographic reproduction of three birdhouses topped with a layer of snow. Each birdhouse has a unique shape—one sphere, one cube, one bow-tie—and each have geometric decoration. A snow-covered tree appears in the background. Printed in red, diagonally, bottom left: Merry Christmas; bottom right: joella – herbert / bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year from Herbert Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert Bayer Christmas card. Bifoliate leaf folded in quarters. At upper right, scene of burning fortified classical building. Two cupids below look up towards the scene. Printed in black, center left: merry christmas and a happy new year; left bottom: from herbert bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and a Happy 1947, Joella and Herbert Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Joella and Herbert Bayer Christmas card featuring photographic reproduction of the front porch of 234 W. Frances Street covered in icicles and snow. Verso: Printed in red: MERRY / CHRISTMAS / AND A HAPPY 1947 / JOELLA / HERBERT / BAYER; red rectilinear border.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and Happy 1973, Joella and Herbert Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Joella and Herbert Bayer Christmas card featuring a black and white photomontage print, a thicket of birch trees with several human eyes embedded in the trees' bark. At right, a pair of human eyes layered on top of the scene. Printed in black, along the bottom: merry christmas and happy 1973  joella and herbert bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: To My Valentine (Greeting card)
description: A small girl in profile walking, wearing a black dress with orange and pink blossoms, red shoes, and a blue bonnet. She holds a bouquet of flowers in one hand, and in the other a sign with a greeting, in white on blue ground, sign: TO MY / [...]A[...]TINE. Her feet are attached with a hinge that rotates, allowing her to walk.
medium: Die-cut lithograph with ribbon and metal hinge

title: Remembrance Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: Simulated montage of prints of birds, dogs, famous paintings, etc. In center, a girl holding the leaf of a book inscribed: "One spare leaf yet remains to claim your kind Remembrance".
medium: Brush and oil paint on paper
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Remembrance Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: Simulated montage of prints of birds, dogs, famous paintings, etc. In center, a girl holding the leaf of a book inscribed: 'One spare leaf yet remains to claim your kind Remembrance". Mounted in a wreath (mounted on paper).
medium: Brush and oil paint on paper
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Christmas Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: Bunch of flowers in scalloped enframement. The flowers are hinged and under them, in the inscription: "A Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Christmas Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: Children are seen busy in a kitchen. They are dressed as three cooks and a kitchen maid. At top: "A Happy Christmas".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Christmas Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: A winter sprite is seen standing in the snow manipulating two marionettes. Below: "A Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year".
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Christmas Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: Simulated fan of f ive sections, each with a scenic madallion. Under the first medallion is the season's greeting, and under the second, a poem.
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Friendship Greeting, Carnation (Greeting Card)
description: Standing man with carnations before him, Four-line verse; below, at top left: "Carnation".
medium: Brush and oil paint on cardboard
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Valentine Greeting (Greeting Card)
description: Poem, "Forget me not" of four lines within a Baroque Revival frame.
medium: Gold and rose ink printed on embossed paper
provenance: Hamill and Barker, Chicago, IL; 1961: acquired by Museum

title: Greeting card
description: with envelope

title: Greeting card
description: One of eleven miscellaneous cards without designation of origin. This one depicts a winter scene with a house in the background. In the foreground, a boy offers a girl a branch of mistletoe.
provenance: Carol MacDonald

title: Greeting card
description:
Post Card:  cards used in Turkey at the feast of Bayram (?) following Ramadam.
Horizontal and vertical rectangles: Six greeting cards showing birds carrying flowers or letters, clasped hands and scenes. Purchased by donor Bursa, Turkey, June, 1953

Jewish New Year, 1959, Elaine and Arthur Cohen (Greeting card)
description: Square white card, embossed design of Hebrew words at center. At bottom center, printed gray text.
medium: Letterpress and embossing on ivory wove paper
provenance: Tamar Cohen and Dave Slatoff, New York, NY; 1993: acquired by Museum

title: In the Beginning, The Museum of Modern Art, New York, NY (Greeting card)
description: Greeting card with the image of a silver and gray striped star against a white, silver, and gray backgound.
provenance: Tamar Cohen and Dave Slatoff, New York, NY; 1993: acquired by Museum

title: Two Twelve and Housing Wo (Greeting card)
Art Center College of Design (Greeting card)
description: (a): Invitation with envelope; invitation is in the shape of a circular map of the earth as though an atlas with a metal hinge that opens into two semicircles to reveal the details of the invitation. In green and orange. (b): the envelope is white and square with text in orange and green: ART CENTER COLLEGE OF DESIGN 1700 LIDA STREET PASADENA / CALIFORNIA 91103.
provenance: Rebeca Méndez; 1996: acquired by Museum

title: Dallas (Greeting card)
description: Cut-out of downtown Dallas skyline

title: San Francisco (Greeting card)
description: Cut-out of downtown San Francisco skyline.

title: Washington, D.C. / The Nation's Capitol (Greeting card)
description: Cut-out of Washington, D.C. skyline

title: New York City/Statue of Liberty (Greeting card)
description: Cut-out of Statue of Liberty, New York City

title: Menorah (Greeting card)
description: Greeting card for the Jewish holiday of Hanukkah. Features a white menorah with nine candles and a six-pointed Star of David cut out of the center. Below, on the triangular-shaped base, a larger, blue and white Star of David appears in the center.
medium: Die-cut heavy white and blue paper
provenance: Ted Naos, Baltimore, MD; 1998: acquired by Museum

title: 1962 New Years Greeting Card
description: Folding card; red exterior, green "paint stroke" interior
medium: Printing on heavy white glossy card stock

title: Christmas/New Years Greeting Card
description: Red sheep on cover; partial red sheep inside right edge
medium: Print on heavy blue card stock

title: R.E.M.: All Our Best For The Holidays (Greeting Card)
Valentine (Greeting Card)
description: Heart-shaped lasercut Valentine's day card
provenance: Marian Bantjes until October 2, 2012

title: Valentine (Greeting Card)
description: Heart-shaped lasercut Valentine's day card
provenance: Marian Bantjes until October 2, 2012

title: Season's Greetings (Greeting card)
description: Greeting card illustrated with a city street during a snowstorm in winter. Groups of male figures in black hats and uniforms in the street shoveling snow into trailers pulled by horses and automobiles. On sidewalks, rows of pedestrians, many with umbrellas. Two streetlights and perspective view of buildings in foreground, view of abstracted shop fronts and buildings at left. Blue vertical border at left edge with a column of white snowflakes. Printed text interior.
provenance: Marilyn Friedman, New York, NY; 2016 acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year 1962, Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring a reproduction of Bayer's painting, "Linear Structure with Orange Field" (1959), an abstract composition with black, blue, orange, and white rectangular shapes and lines. Verso: Printed in orange, across lower portion: merry christmas and a happy new year  1962 herbert and joella bayer.
medium: Offset lithograph on glossy white paper
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and Happy 1956, Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring abstract design made of small blue vertical and horizontal lines, densely grouped, with curving spaces between groups. Printed in blue, along the bottom: merry christmas and happy 1956  herbert and joella bayer.
medium: Offset lithograph on glossy off-white cardstock
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and Happy 1955, Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting Card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring abstract design in white on dark blue background. At top, curving white V-shaped lines superimposed over vertical white lines that extend to bottom. Printed text in white below: merry christmas and happy 1955 herbert and joella bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas & Happy New Year, Joella and Herbert Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Red Joella and Herbert Bayer Christmas card. At center, Santa in sleigh pulled by reindeer in raised gold foil. Printed in black, along the bottom: merry christmas & happy new year / joella / herbert } bayer.
medium: Print on red paper with embossed gold foil
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas & Happy New Year, Joella and Herbert Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Joella and Herbert Bayer Christmas card. At center, decorated Christmas tree on stand in raised silver foil against a blue background. Printed in dark green cursive text, along the bottom: merry christmas & happy new year / joella / herbert } bayer.
medium: Print on blue paper with embossed silver foil
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Merry Christmas and Happy 1959 from Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring abstract forms composed of multiple grouped lines in white and black on a red background. Printed in black, lower margin: merry christmas and happy 1959 from herbert and joella bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: WCAU-TV Philadelphia (Greeting card)
description: Square greeting card featuring Herbert Bayer's painting "The Yellow Center." Printed text, interior: SEASON'S GREETINGS FROM THE STAFF OF WCAU-TV. Verso: Small black and white photoreproduction of printed recto image with credit to Herbert Bayer. Printed text below: Screen print 1970, 31" x 31" / Herbert Bayer, Austrial designer 1900- / Reproduced in cooperation with the Philadelphia Museum of Art / and with permission from Marlborough Graphics Inc; same design as 7102.845.2016, 7102.847.2016.

title: Greetings from Aspen's Touring Country, Merry Christmas and Happy Near Year from Herbert and Joella Bayer (Greeting card)
description: Herbert and Joella Bayer Christmas card featuring black and white photographic reproduction of ski slopes in Aspen, Colorado with superimposed Aspen logo (green aspen tree leaf with white snowflake) at lower left and center right. Printed in green cursive script, lower right: Greetings from Aspen's Touring Country. Verso: Aspen logo in green at top, green ruled borders. Printed in red, left: merry christmas / and / happy new year / from / herbert and joella / bayer.
provenance: Herbert Bayer; Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, New York, NY; 2016: acquired by Museum

title: Seasons Greetings Card: SEE SON a GREE THINGS ha (announcement)
description: 1989 greeting card announcing seasons greeting in form of a business card.  Various sizes, styles of text.  Top line of text is green.  Middle and bottom lines are maroon.

title: What Reason So To Knock (greeting card)
description:
Poster/ greeting card printed in black ink.  Text in calligraohic style throughout.
Recto: Across center, text giving holiday greeting; along edges, abstract flourishes and good luck symbols such as horseshoe, four leaf clover.  Lower right quadrant, affixed small round sticker with green tree on white with red edge. 
Verso: Across sheet, map overlaid by grid; at center of each square, small circle with heavenly body such as star, planet, comet inside.
